item.title: 根据一份新的联邦公告，在总统提名大会开始前的几个月，执法部门已经在计划开展大规模的工作，以保护定于今年夏天举行的总统提名大会。
item.description:
Months before they’re set to begin, law enforcement is already planning a massive effort to protect the presidential nominating conventions set for this summer, according to a new federal bulletin. https://t.co/IKQ7Y9NkdC

— ABC News (@ABC) February 23, 2024

item.title: "很多长期COVID症状......经常被写成'哦，那都是你的幻觉'，但这项研究表明了其背后的实际生物机制。"这项小型研究显示了一些长期COVID患者出现 "脑雾 "的可能原因。
item.description:
"A lot of long COVID symptoms ... are often written off as 'oh that’s all in your head' but this study is suggesting an actual biological mechanism behind it."

Small study shows a possible reason some long COVID patients experience "brain fog." https://t.co/sJq7scc1Nv

— ABC News (@ABC) February 23, 2024

item.title: 周四，西班牙巴伦西亚市一座公寓楼发生火灾，造成四人死亡，14 人失踪：
item.description:
A fire engulfed an apartment block in the Spanish city of Valencia on Thursday, killing four people and leaving 14 others missing, authorities said.

item.title: 随着俄罗斯在乌克兰的战争进入两周年，俄罗斯再次发动攻击，袭击前线城市。这些袭击发生时，国际社会对基辅的援助已经放缓，这意味着乌克兰的武器储备越来越少。
item.description:
As Russia's war in Ukraine hits the two-year mark, Russia is again on the attack, striking cities along the frontline.

Those attacks are coming as international aid for Kyiv has slowed, meaning Ukrainian weapons stockpiles are growing ever smaller. https://t.co/GQMeFPWoRd

— ABC News (@ABC) February 23, 2024

item.title: 在全世界纪念俄罗斯进攻乌克兰两年之际，美国宣布对俄罗斯、其支持者及其战争机器实施 500 多项制裁。
item.description:
The U.S. has announced more than 500 sanctions on Russia, its enablers, and its war machine as the world marks two years since Russia attacked Ukraine.

This is the largest single tranche since the start of Putin's invasion, administration officials said. https://t.co/w3VllmtOBh

— ABC News (@ABC) February 23, 2024

item.title: 据基辅估计，莫斯科的损失超过 30 万名士兵，因此乌克兰当局发起了一个名为 "想寻找 "的项目，帮助俄罗斯公民寻找他们在乌克兰参战的亲属的信息。
item.description:

— ABC News (@ABC) February 23, 2024

item.title: 现年 99 岁的前总统吉米-卡特（Jimmy Carter）是第一位在世时获得白宫官方圣诞饰品殊荣的美国总统。

item.title: 一名法官周四裁定，得克萨斯州一名黑人高中生因拒绝改变发型而面临的处罚不违反该州的《皇冠法》（CROWN Act），该法禁止基于种族的发型歧视。
item.description:
A judge ruled Thursday that the punishment faced by a Black high school student in Texas for refusing to change his hairstyle does not violate the state's CROWN Act, which prohibits race-based hair discrimination. https://t.co/jnq3eKPnvr

— ABC News (@ABC) February 23, 2024

item.title: 移民与海关执法局（ICE）的一位高级官员说，只需对立法稍作修改，就可以允许更多的国土安全调查局特工调查毒品犯罪，而无需首先获得司法部的授权。
item.description: It would only take a small change in legislation to allow more Homeland Security Investigations agents to investigate drug crimes without first getting the authority to do so from the Justice Department, a top ICE official said. trib.al/rbGifXf

item.title:
据美国电话电报公司（AT&T）称，周四美国用户受到的临时网络中断是由软件更新引起的。
更多信息
item.description:
A temporary network disruption that affected AT&T customers in the U.S. on Thursday was caused by a software update, according to the company.

Read more: trib.al/8B5lkRv
